text: The 2003 NCAA Division III Men's Ice Hockey Tournament was the culmination of the 2002–03 season, the 20th such tournament in NCAA history. It concluded with Norwich defeating Oswego State in the championship game 2-1. All First Round and Quarterfinal matchups were held at home team venues, while all succeeding games were played in Norwich, Vermont. ==Qualifying teams== The following teams qualified for the tournament. Automatic bids were offered to the conference tournament champion of seven different conferences with one at- large bid for the best remaining team from each region. {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="6" style="background:#ffdead;" | East ! colspan="6" style="background:#ffdead;" | West |- !style="background: #e3e3e3;"| School || Conference || Record || Berth Type || Appearance || Last Bid || School || Conference || Record || Berth Type || Appearance || Last Bid |- | Elmira | ECAC West | 18–7–2 | Tournament Champion | 9th | 1997 | Saint John's | MIAC | 20–6–1 | Tournament Champion | 4th | 2001 |- | Middlebury | NESCAC | 21–4–2 | At–Large | 9th | 2002 | St. Norbert | NCHA | 26–1–2 | Tournament Champion | 5th | 2002 |- | Norwich | ECAC East | 24–3–0 | Tournament Champion | 6th | 2002 | Wisconsin–River Falls | NCHA | 22–6–1 | At–Large | 9th | 2001 |- | Oswego State | SUNYAC | 23–6–1 | Tournament Champion | 7th | 1998 |- | Trinity | NESCAC | 19–5–2 | Tournament Champion | 1st | Never |- | Wentworth | ECAC Northeast | 21–4–3 | Tournament Champion | 3rd | 2002 |} ==Format== The tournament featured four rounds of play. All rounds were Single-game elimination. For the three eastern Quarterfinals the teams were seeded according to their rankings with the top three teams serving as hosts.
